p: The concentration of hydrogen peroxide (H 2O 2) was quantified based to the method described previously by Loreto and Velikova [ 41] at 390 nm and results were expressed as nmol of H 2O 2 per kg of fresh weight (nmol kg −1 H 2O 2). Lipid peroxidation of minimally processed lettuce was evaluated using the 2-thiobarbituric acid reactive substances method measuring the absorbance at 532 and 600 nm as previously described [ 42], using a spectrophotometer (Multiskan GO, Thermo Fisher Scientific Oy, Finland). Results were expressed as nmol of malondialdeyde (MDA) per kg of fresh weight (nmol kg −1 MDA).
